html:
Best Overall

Morrocanoil Moroccanoil Treatment

Pros

  • A little goes a long way

Cons

  • May be too heavy for extra-fine hair

This oil is the answer to all your hair care prayers. Made for all hair types, the argan oil elixir smooths frizz and boosts shine, while conditioning, detangling, and providing heat protection. Fragranced with Moroccanoil's signature scent, it works on both dry and damp hair and keeps your hair smelling fresh all day long.

Key ingredients: Argan oil, linseed extract

When to apply: Damp or dry

Amazon rating: 4.7/5

An ELLE editor says: “I've tried a lot of hair oils over the years, and I always come back to the Moroccanoil Treatment. I apply it through my mid-lengths to ends after styling, and any frizz, flyaways, or unwanted poofy texture immediately disappears. Both the impressive shine and delicious scent last all day long.”—Emma Aerin Becker, Associate Beauty E-Commerce Writer

Best for Shine

Kérastase Elixir Ultime Hair Oil

Pros

  • Heat protectant
  • Refillable packaging

Despite feeling incredibly lightweight, the Kérastase Elixir Ultime Hair Oil delivers an insane gloss that lasts. Formulated with marula, argan, and wild camellia oils, this product is incredibly nourishing and provides heat protection up to 450°F.

Key ingredients: Marula oil, argan oil, wild camellia oil

When to apply: Wet or dry

Sephora rating: 4.4/5

An ELLE editor says: “Because this product is so lightweight, I love to use it before and/or after I use a curling iron. It boosts shine, tames frizz, and makes my hair feel so soft without weighing down my fresh curls.”—Emma Aerin Becker

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for Damaged Hair

K18 Molecular Repair Hair Oil

Pros

  • Works on all hair types and textures

Nobody reverses hair damage like K18. The brand's Molecular Repair Hair Oil restores from the inside out with its patented K18PEPTIDE, targeting deep damage that causes frizz and restoring strength at the hair’s core. On the surface, avocado and sunflower oils smooth flyaways, boost shine, enhance color vibrancy, and protect against heat up to 450°F.

Key ingredients: K18PEPTIDE, squalene, avocado oil

When to apply: Damp or dry

Sephora rating: 4.5/5

A Sephora reviewer says: “This is the holy grail! It fixed my damaged bleached hair and brought it back to life. I have repurchased soooo many times.”

Best for Frizzy Hair

Olaplex No. 7 Bonding Oil

Just as its name implies, the Olaplex No. 7 Bonding Oil works to bond your split ends back together for a frizz-free, ultra-smooth finish. The weightless, heat-protectant styling oil instantly boosts shine and softness.

Key ingredients: Coconut oil, vitamin E, sunflower seed oil

When to apply: Damp or dry hair

Sephora rating: 4.1/5

An ELLE editor says: ”I've always been a huge fan of Olaplex. I use their shampoo, conditioner, and hair smoother every time I wash my hair. And now the Bonding Oil has become my favorite hair oil to apply to my damp hair before styling. It protects my strands from heat damage, doesn't feel heavy on my ends, and creates a frizz-free result that's never greasy.”—Emma Aerin Becker

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for Smoothing

Oribe Gold Lust Nourishing Hair Oil

Pros

  • Deeply conditions and strengthens

Cons

  • Packaging leaks got some

Tailored specifically with dry, damaged, and color-treated hair in mind, the Oribe Gold Lust Nourishing Hair Oil will restore your locks without looking greasy. It's also fast-absorbing for instant shine and heat protection.

Key ingredients: Argan oil, cassis seed oil, jasmine oil, shea butter

When to apply: Damp hair

Sephora rating: 4.3/5

A Sephora reviewer says: “I have been using Oribe’s Gold Lust hair oil for several years and it never fails to impress! This product worked beautifully on my brown, blonde and even red hair experimentation! Using only a tiny bit of the product goes a long way, so the bottle will last a long time. It is worth every dollar. Your hair will shine like silk.”

Best for Dry Hair

Gisou Honey Infused Hair Oil

Pros

  • Ideal for all hair types

This uniquely formulated hair oil is ultra-hydrating, thanks to mirsalehi honey—a powerful natural humectant sourced from Gisou's own bee garden. It's designed to reduce frizz and enhance shine on all hair types and textures, working especially well on dry hair due to its long-lasting hydration.

Key ingredients: Mirsalehi honey, bee garden oils

When to apply: Damp or dry hair

Sephora rating: 4.2/5

A Sephora reviewer says: “This oil makes my hair so soft and shiny without feeling greasy! The scent is sweet in the best way and actually sticks around, which I love. I use a few drops on damp hair and it makes everything smoother and less frizzy. This has been a staple in humid summer weather!”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for Color-Treated Hair

Ouai Hair Oil

Cons

  • No cover for pump applicator

There's nothing worse than applying a hair oil just for your locks to feel heavy and greasy. Ouai ensures you never face this dilemma with their ultra-lightweight Hair Oil. Additionally, African galanga root extract helps protect color-treated hair from fading and color degradation.

Key ingredients: Ama oil, African galanga root extract, borage oil, baobab seed oil

When to apply: Wet or dry hair

Amazon rating: 4.5/5

An Amazon reviewer says: “I absolutely LOVE this product! My hair is very frizzy and this oil has made such a difference! The oil is lightweight, smells amazing (if you like jasmine scents), and a little goes a long way. I use it on wet hair, and when I'm done styling I put it on my ends. And let me tell you THE SHINE. It doesn't have any harsh chemicals which is nice.”

Best for Hydratiion

Augustinus Bader The Hair Oil

The Augustinus Bader Hair Oil is like a tall glass of water for your hair. Powered by their patented TFC8 technology and packed with deeply nourishing, restorative botanicals—like baobab, argan, and pomegranate oils—the product reduces breakage, combats visible damage, and intensely hydrates.

Key ingredients: Baobab oil, argan oil, vitamin E

When to apply: Damp or dry hair

Bloomingdale's rating: 4.1/5

An ELLE editor says: “The Hair Oil from Augustinus Bader feels just as luxurious as it looks. My favorite part is the unique dropper lid, which makes application an absolute breeze. Of course, the oil itself is also amazing—super lightweight and moisturizing without feeling heavy.”—Emma Aerin Becker

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for Hair Growth

Pura D'orr Scalp & Hair Strengthening Oil

Pros

  • Thickens hair overtime

“My absolute favorite hair oil is the Pura D’or Scalp & Hair Strengthening Oil,” says Giannetos. While it works on all hair types, he highly recommends it for those with fine, weak hair or stressed hair that has been damaged by chemical processing. “It’s like a miracle in a bottle to rebuild proteins and strengthen hair starting at the root.”

Key ingredients: Rosemary oil. peppermint oil, castor oil

When to apply: Dry hair before washing

Amazon rating: 4.5/5

An Amazon reviewer says: “This Pura D’or Hair Strengthening Oil is great. I’ve been using it for over 2.5 months now, and combined with the hair growth regimen I already use, it has helped with new growth and overall strength. It’s weightless and doesn’t make my hair greasy. My hair is shedding less, and I have tons of baby hairs all over my head. I apply it in the morning when I wake up, let it sit for about 30 minutes while I enjoy my coffee, and then rinse it out in the shower.”

Best Heat Protectant

Shu Uemura Essence Absolue Nourishing Protective Hair Oil

Cons

  • May not be best for fine hair

As someone who constantly uses hot tools to touch up my hair, I love a hair oil with heat protectant. The Shu Uemura Essence Absolue Nourishing Protective Hair Oil not only nourishes, enhances shine, and reduces frizz, but its Japanese-sourced red camellia oil protects against heat up to 450°F.

Key ingredients: Red camellia oil, vitamins A, C, E

When to apply: Damp or dry hair

Sephora rating: 4.7/5

A Sephora reviewer says: “I have fine, wavy hair and I use this oil everyday. Not only does it protect my hair when I do a blow out, it smoothes and hydrates my hair without leaving it oily. My hair is hydrated and silky. I have used other oils that I thought were good, but this one wins.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

How to use hair oil

The way you use hair oil depends on your hair type. Giannetos confirms that it can be beneficial in any phase of your hair care routine, although different textures may benefit more from specific techniques. For thick hair, he recommends applying oil directly and using it as a treatment mask for 30 minutes to an hour before shampooing. For medium hair, apply it to wet strands for “deep penetration” or mix it into your shampoo or conditioner. Those with thin, fine hair should be more cautious to avoid weighing strands down. “Applying oil from mid-lengths to ends will boost moisture and shine while taming frizz and flyaways,” concludes Giannetos.

What to look for in a hair oil?

In general, Giannetos says hair products with natural, plant-based ingredients and high-quality oils deliver the best results. However, it’s essential to consider your hair type when selecting a hair oil. Those with fine hair should opt for lighter oils that absorb easily—like jojoba, grapeseed, and sweet almond. Medium-thick hair responds well to argan, coconut, and rosemary oils. Thick, dry hair can handle all of the above, plus richer options like olive and avocado oil.
